intro: Dichaea tuberculilabris, commonly known as the tuberculate leaf dichaea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Bromeliaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its rosette of fleshy, tuberculate leaves that form a central cup to collect rainwater. It produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Dichaea tuberculilabris is often grown as a decorative plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in shaded, humid environments.
